intro: Microstylis andicola, commonly known as the Andean microstylis, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its small, delicate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are adapted to wind pollination. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
